author: Steve Robson
title: Heidelberg car attack: First picture of suspect brandishing knife as police forced to highlight 'non-migrant' background
text:
Man shot by police after driving into pedestrians in Germany Share this video Watch Next 
The local police have taken to Twitter to clarify the incident is not being treated as terrorism and that the suspect does not have a migrant background. 
The Police Mannheim account has even gone to effort of confronting those spreading false information on Twitter. Footage posted online purportedly shows the moment police shot the driver (Photo: Twitter / @APetchoice) The car had ploughed into a crowd of pedestrians (Photo: Twitter / @APetchoice) Police stand near the spot where the suspect was shot (Photo: Getty Images) Police surround the car after the pedestrians were mowed down (Photo: Getty) Read More Driver ploughs into crowd of pedestrians in Heidelberg, Germany, leaving three people injured 
Police say the suspect was armed with a knife when he ploughed into the pedestrians in front of a bakery at around 4pm local time on Saturday. 
Witnesses pointed him out to police as he fled on foot and he was later shot in front of a row of shops and flats. Emergency personnel respond to the incident (Photo: Getty Images) The car that rammed into the pedestrians was rented (Photo: Getty Images) Heavily-armed police officers were called to the scene (Photo: Getty Images) 
Police opened fire after he allegedly ignored orders to drop the weapon, Heidelberg 24 reported. 
The suspect was seriously injured in the shooting and was receiving treatment in hospital. 
Investigators did not reveal the man's motives or background, but say a terror background was not suspected and he is thought to have acted alone. 
Local media reports suggested the man was suffering from mental health issues. Forensic officers investigate at the scene (Photo: Twitter @raphael_rauch) The area has been cordoned off by police (Photo: Twitter / @ PoliceMannheim) 
The car drove into the crowd in a pedestrian area in Heidelberg's Bismarckplatz area, with the car coming to a stop near the entrance to the bakery. 
Hours later forensics teams in white outfits were seen examining the black car after it was cordoned off. Read More 
In December an attacker deliberately drove a lorry into the Christmas market in Berlin, killing 12 people and injuring more than 50. 
That attack was claimed by the terror group ISIS. Like us on Facebook
